caption:
This photograph captures a close-up of a small green frog nestled among reddish-purple and green water-lily pads. The frog is positioned at the center of the image, its body partly submerged in water. It has translucent, delicate skin that reveals some of its internal structures, suggesting it might be a young or particularly small species of frog. The lily pads it rests on are glossy and dappled with sparkling water droplets, emphasizing the amphibian's aquatic habitat.

The background and surroundings are blurred and indistinct, focusing the viewer's attention on the frog and the immediate surface of the water pads. The colors are rich and saturated, with the deep hues of the lily pads contrasting sharply against the bright green of the frog. The overall effect is both vibrant and tranquil, highlighting a small moment of natural beauty and serenity in a watery environment.
title: Close- up of a skunk cabbage (lysichiton kamtschatcense) just unfurling the first green leaves of spring in wet lands of timberland on vancouver island, british Columbia.  Near port alberni, british Columbia, canada.  From the the environmental protection agencys project documerica collection, "in praise of forests".  For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213.  Entheos.  April, 1969.
